revised_title: Neutron and X-ray Diffraction Studies on Naphthazarin C Polymorphism
tldr: The article discusses the crystal structure and polymorphism of naphthazarin C, a molecule with potential energy surfaces that have a symmetric double minimum. Neutron diffraction and X-ray diffraction studies reveal that the molecule undergoes intramolecular proton exchange at room temperature, and the structure of naphthazarin C is compared to its polymorphs A and B. The findings contribute to the understanding of intramolecular hydrogen transfer in solid-state chemistry.
